title: ISRAEL PALESTINE CONFLICT
text:
Historical Context:
The rise of zionism (Jewish nationalist movement that aims for creation of Jewish state in Palestine) began in the late 19th to 20th century. The large amount of anti-semitism in Europe had popularised this belief.
Britain colonised Palestine after the defeat of the Ottoman empire shortly after WW1. The region was inhabited by Jewish, Arab and other ethnic group minorities.The Balfour Declaration issued by the British Government in 1917 stated its support for the establishment of a "national home for the Jewish people" in Palestine. Jews claimed that Palestine was their ancestral home, the Palestinians strongly opposed this.
Before and during WW2, many Jews fled to Palestine to escape the persecution led by the Nazis. Tensions between the local Palestinians, Jews, and the British rule were high. The United Nations had voted for Palestine to split into Jewish and Arab states with Jerusalem as an international city. This was rejected by the local Palestinians but accepted by Zionists, with them intending to expand further than the UN‚Äôs allocated borders.
